New Delhi Kehilangan Turis akibat Polusi
07 Nov 2019, 13:20 by Putu Intan Raka Cinti


Kabut polusi di New Delhi. (Foto: Reuters)

New Delhi - Sudah lebih dari satu pekan kabut polusi melanda New Delhi, India. Imbas negatif pun ikut dirasakan sektor pariwisata di sana.South China Morning Post menyebut, turis kini cenderung menghindari New Delhi baik untuk urusan bisnis maupun liburan. Hal ini terjadi karena ibukota India tersebut tengah dilanda kabut polusi yang telah mencapai level tertinggi dalam sejarah India.Kepala Kantor Operasi Yatra Online mengatakan, pemesanan hotel dan pesawat ke New Delhi terus menurun usai perayaan festival Diwali pada 27 Oktober lalu.Menurut situs travel Ixigo, pemesanan dan pencarian terkait travel ke New Delhi dari negara Singapura, Thailand, dan Qatar telah turun sebesar 44 persen. Di sisi lain, pemesanan dan pertanyaan dari New Delhi ke destinasi lain meningkat sebesar 25 persen.Kabut polisi yang tebal di New Delhi telah membuat sejumlah penerbangan dibatalkan. Selain itu sekolah juga ikut diliburkan karena level polusi yang dianggap berbahaya.


Kabut polusi di New Delhi (Foto: Reuters)

Kabut di New Delhi ini disebabkan terbakarnya sejumlah ladang di sekitar wilayah kota. Berdasarkan pantauan detikcom melalui situs AirVisual, sampai Rabu pukul 15.00 WIB kualitas udara dan polusi di New Delhi berada di angka 190, dimana untuk kondisi udara yang baik ada di bawah 50.Kondisi polusi di New Delhi saat ini telah berlangsung selama 10 hari. Kondisi ini lebih parah dibandingkan kabut polusi terlama yang pernah dialami New Delhi selama 7 hari berturut-turut pada awal 2016 silam. Polusi ini tentunya berbahaya untuk kesehatan karena dapat menimbulkan risiko stroke, penyakit jantung dan kanker paru-paru.Sampai saat ini, pemerintah provinsi dan nasional mengambil kebijakan dengan membatasi penggunaan kendaraan pribadi dan menutup beberapa pabrik. New Delhi loses tourists due to pollution
Nov 7 2019, 13:20 by Putu Intan Raka Cinti


Fog of pollution in New Delhi. (Photo: Reuters)

New Delhi - It's been more than a week of pollution fog sweeping New Delhi, India. The negative impact was also felt by the tourism sector there. South China Morning Post said, tourists now tend to avoid New Delhi both for business and leisure. This happened because the Indian capital was hit by pollution fog that had reached the highest level in Indian history. Head of the Yatra Online Operations Office said hotel and airplane bookings to New Delhi continued to decline after the Diwali festival celebration on 27 October. According to the Ixigo travel site, bookings and travel-related searches to New Delhi from Singapore, Thailand and Qatar have fallen by 44 percent. On the other hand, bookings and inquiries from New Delhi to other destinations increased by 25 percent. A thick police mist in New Delhi has caused a number of flights to be canceled. In addition, schools are also closed because of pollution levels that are considered dangerous.


Fog of pollution in New Delhi (Photo: Reuters)

The fog in New Delhi is caused by the burning of a number of fields around the city. Based on the monitoring of detikcom through the AirVisual website, until Wednesday at 15:00 WIB air quality and pollution in New Delhi are at 190, where for good air conditions is below 50. Pollution conditions in New Delhi currently have lasted for 10 days. This condition is more severe than the longest pollution haze ever experienced by New Delhi for 7 consecutive days in early 2016 ago. This pollution is certainly dangerous to health because it can pose a risk of stroke, heart disease and lung cancer. Until now, the provincial and national governments have adopted a policy of limiting the use of private vehicles and closing some factories.
